page.title: 06Life Styles (Birkenshaw)
page.content: Recent boundary changes meant merger with Leeds Metro,who have plans to house their overspill population in Drighlington. Barratts offer new det.house Â£40,000. {Birkenshaw}is mostly modern.There are only a few streets with older houses built of stone,like the old terrace houses in Mill Lane,Allencroft ,Croft Street and Southfield Terrace. Along Station Lane there are large detached villas standing in large gardens.These houses are about a hundred years old.The other old houses are farmhouses on the edge of Birkenshaw village and on land between Birkenshaw and Drighlington. Early in this century some brick built semidetached houses were built in Moorland Drive,Birkhill Crescent, Whitehall Grove and Whitehall Road.But since the 1950's modern estates of mix
